unnormalised: First, start with your name (e.g., Priya Sharma) and then your house number (like, say, #23/A) and the building name (if applicable, like "Sunshine Apartments"). The next line should have the street name or the area (example: "MG Road"). Don't forget the landmark (e.g., "Near SBI Bank"). Landmarks are super useful for the delivery person, especially in crowded areas. This is how my cousin in Bangalore formats it - seems to work for her.
normalised: First, start with your name (e.g., Priya Sharma) and then your house number (like, say, hash two three slash A) and the building name (if applicable, like "Sunshine Apartments"). The next line should have the street name or the area (example: "M-G Road"). Don't forget the landmark (e.g., "Near S-B-I Bank"). Landmarks are super useful for the delivery person, especially in crowded areas. This is how my cousin in Bangalore formats it - seems to work for her.

unnormalised: Then comes the city (e.g., Mumbai), the state (Maharashtra - you can abbreviate it as MH), and, most importantly, the PIN code (like 400001). Always double-check that PIN code; it's crucial for sorting. A lot of the deliveries use PIN codes for initial sorting, so make sure it’s correct! You can add your phone number (e.g., +91 9876543210) at the beginning or the end, some sites have a separate field for it anyway.

You can add your phone number (e.g., plus nine one nine eight seven six five four three two one zero) at the beginning or the end, some sites have a separate field for it anyway.
